meanings.definition: To have a presentiment of; to anticipate or predict.
meanings.sent1: She forefeels the storm coming before anyone else.
meanings.sent2: He always forefeels when something bad is about to happen.
meanings.sent3: The cat forefeels the arrival of visitors and hides under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition forefeels the outcome of the game with uncanny accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's weathered bones forefeels the change in the wind.

meanings.definition: To have a feeling or intuition about something before it happens.
meanings.sent1: They forefeels the excitement building up for the concert.
meanings.sent2: I often forefeels a sense of deja vu in new situations.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller forefeels winning lottery numbers in her dreams.
meanings.sent4: His gut feeling forefeels the success of the business venture.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl forefeels the changing seasons with hoots of warning.
